content.description: Three cruxes of 5.10 for a 80 foot pitch. sustained with one good rest at the bottom. the route follows the rappel line in the picture
content.protection: a boulder at the top can be slung and there is two stopper slots #10-12.

climbs.name: Paddle UP
climbs.fa: Unknown, but likely a 12 year old Ojibwe child circa 1600.

content.description: Good quality, highly textured basalt rising directly from Lake Superior. The best approach is by SUP or kayak. There are okay gear placements every 15-20 feet, with a bomber #3 placement at the halfway point. Anchoring off of trees is prohibited by the City of Marquette.
content.protection: Standard rack. If anchoring SUPs or kayaks at base, there is a crack at water level that will take a .75 or 1.
content.location: Located about 200 meters north of the pinnacle. The best approach is to paddle by SUP or kayak from the breakwall beach.Â

content.description: The route goes straight up the middle of the back face of the Pinnacle. Start below the right hand side of the big ledge, mantel up and move slightly right to climb for two moves up a column like feature. Using the undercling, move out left onto the face and climb straight up. the last move is the crux
content.protection: sling the small block to the climbers right, and place a yellow alien (or something similar) in a finger crack directly at the top of the main route on the other side.
